head.title: World Business Briefing | Europe: France: Bank's Profit Triples

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Europe: France: Bank's Profit Triples

abstract.p: Credit Lyonnais says net profit more than tripled in fourth quarter, to 241 million euros ($261 million); for year, net profit rose 5 percent, to 853 million euros ($924 million) (S)

block.p: The French bank Crédit Lyonnais said that net profit more than tripled in the fourth quarter, helped by strong retail growth. Fourth-quarter net profit was 241 million euros ($261 million), up from 78 million euros ($84.5 million) a year earlier. For the year, net profit rose 5 percent, to 853 million euros ($924 million). The chairman, Jean Peyrelevade, said earnings should continue to rise in 2003 if economic conditions did not deteriorate. The results improve its case for a planned merger with a French rival, Crédit Agricole. The plan is being reviewed by the French bank regulator.

The French bank Crédit Lyonnais said that net profit more than tripled in the fourth quarter, helped by strong retail growth. Fourth-quarter net profit was 241 million euros ($261 million), up from 78 million euros ($84.5 million) a year earlier. For the year, net profit rose 5 percent, to 853 million euros ($924 million). The chairman, Jean Peyrelevade, said earnings should continue to rise in 2003 if economic conditions did not deteriorate. The results improve its case for a planned merger with a French rival, Crédit Agricole. The plan is being reviewed by the French bank regulator.
